metadata.title: CVE-2021-47165 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/meson: fix shutdown crash when component not probed When main componentis not probed, by example when the dw-hdmi module is not loaded yet or inprobe defer, the following crash appears on shutdown: Unable to handlekernel NULL pointer dereference at virtual address 0000000000000038 ... pc: meson_drv_shutdown+0x24/0x50 lr : platform_drv_shutdown+0x20/0x30 ...Call trace: meson_drv_shutdown+0x24/0x50 platform_drv_shutdown+0x20/0x30device_shutdown+0x158/0x360 kernel_restart_prepare+0x38/0x48kernel_restart+0x18/0x68 __do_sys_reboot+0x224/0x250__arm64_sys_reboot+0x24/0x30 ... Simply check if the priv struct has beenallocated before using it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47165` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
